perturbation.original_text:
The Agreement enters into force on the Signing Date; it will have a duration of [*****] as from the Start Date (the “Initial Term”).

Upon expiry of the Initial Term, this Agreement [*****] unless a Notice of non-renewal is given by either Party to the other Party [*****] prior to the expiry of the Initial Term or the end of a renewal period, if any.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Agreement enters into force on the Signing Date; it will have a duration of [*****] as from the Start Date (the “Initial Term”).

Upon expiry of the Initial Term, this Agreement requires mutual written consent to renew. Notice of non-renewal must be given by either Party to the other Party [*****] prior to the expiry of the Initial Term or the end of a renewal period, if any.
perturbation.explanation: Clause 3.2 now introduces a contradiction. The original states that the agreement automatically renews unless a non-renewal notice is given. The modification now states that mutual written consent is needed to renew, conflicting with the auto-renewal concept. The change creates uncertainty as to whether the contract will automatically renew, or require explicit agreement.

perturbation.changed_text:
Such Security Deposit shall be constituted either, as follows, at the option of the Company:


(i)
a cash deposit by SWIFT wire transfer to the bank account indicated in Clause 12.2 (iv); or,


(ii)
one (1) LOC with a validity of at least [*****], acceptable to the Repairer acting reasonably. Such LOC shall be renewed and its confirmation extended, at the latest [*****] before the expiry of each previous LOC; all costs incurred as a result of the issuance and confirmation of the LOC shall be borne by the Company.
It is agreed that the Security Deposit is only valid during the term of this agreement. The cash deposit or the LOC is fully refundable upon completion of the contract.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the security deposit is available for a period after the term, is the property of the Repairer, and non-refundable except as set out in the agreement. The changed text states the Security Deposit is only valid during the agreement and fully refundable upon completion. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the security deposit's validity and whether or not it is refundable and introduces uncertainty about the rights and obligations of the parties concerning the Security Deposit.

perturbation.original_text:
Unless otherwise provided in this Agreement, any Confidential Information released by either of the Parties (the “Disclosing Party”) to the other Party (the “Receiving Party”) shall not be released in whole or in part to any third party.
In particular, the Receiving Party undertakes:
perturbation.changed_text:
Unless otherwise provided in this Agreement, any Confidential Information released by either of the Parties (the “Disclosing Party”) to the other Party (the “Receiving Party”) may be released in whole or in part to any third party at the descretion of the receiving party.
In particular, the Receiving Party undertakes:
perturbation.explanation: The change in the first sentence of Clause 20.1 from "shall not be released" to "may be released" directly contradicts the confidentiality obligations outlined in the rest of Clause 20.1. The original text creates an agreement where the receiving party needs to maintain confidentiality and does not have the ability to release that information. In the new version, it is up to the descretion of the receiving party to release the confidential information and renders the remainder of the clause without effect and useless.
